metadata.title: CVE-2023-4911 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - high
metadata.description:
A buffer overflow was discovered in the GNU C Library's dynamic loaderld.so while processing the GLIBC_TUNABLES environment variable. This issuecould allow a local attacker to use maliciously crafted GLIBC_TUNABLESenvironment variables when launching binaries with SUID permission toexecute code with elevated privileges.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4911` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.35-0ubuntu3.4
libc-bin - 2.35-0ubuntu3.4
libc6 - 2.35-0ubuntu3.4
libc6-amd64 - 2.35-0ubuntu3.4
libc6-i386 - 2.35-0ubuntu3.4
libc6-prof - 2.35-0ubuntu3.4
libc6-s390 - 2.35-0ubuntu3.4
libc6-x32 - 2.35-0ubuntu3.4
locales - 2.35-0ubuntu3.4
locales-all - 2.35-0ubuntu3.4
nscd - 2.35-0ubuntu3.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glibc package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.35-0ubuntu3.4').
